feed.title: Self-Driving Scooter Research
feed.subtitle: Welcome! Our mission is to design self-driving escooters. We are a research team at the University of Maryland under Dr. Paley at the Robotics and Autonomy Lab. Reach out to us if you're interested in joining!

entry.title: Finished the Website
entry.content:
As can be seen, I finished website v1.0! We have a home (landing) page, a research summary page, a publications page, a team page, a contact page, an updates page, a sleek website look, and an official link in “rezoom.umd.edu.” I feel pretty good with where the website is now, and I don’t expect to work much more on it since the website was not a task explicitly given to me nor does the website give particularly significant benefit to the ReZoom team. But, we shall see!

Please let me know any feedback you might have. See you around!
entry.summary: As can be seen, I finished website v1.0! We have a home (landing) page, a research summary page, a publications page, a team page, a contact page, an updates page, a sleek website look, and an official link in “rezoom.umd.edu.” I feel pretty good with where the website is now, and I don’t expect to work much more on it since the website was not a task explicitly given to me nor does the website give particularly significant benefit to the ReZoom team. But, we shall see!

entry.title: Some CAD Mounts Made
entry.content:
Created two new mounts for the GPS and the Motor Controller. I have the files saved on my computer currently so the next step will have to be emailing Dr. Penskiy about using the 3D printers in the Idea Factory since I currently have not been trained on how to use them. There are other mounts I will need to print however so I may wait until they’re all done before continuing with Dr. Penskiy.

Created two more mounts for the components inside of the board. I also adjusted some of the old hole sizes with calipers. There’s one left that I have to work on but after that I should be able to start printing these parts and test if they work right or if they need to be adjusted again.

I’ve printed the first part for the electronics for the inside of the scooter. It fit really well with the GPS so once I get the rest of the parts printed it should be very simple to start attaching them.
entry.summary: Created two new mounts for the GPS and the Motor Controller. I have the files saved on my computer currently so the next step will have to be emailing Dr. Penskiy about using the 3D printers in the Idea Factory since I currently have not been trained on how to use them. There are other mounts I will need to print however so I may wait until they’re all done before continuing with Dr. Penskiy.

entry.title: First Update!
entry.content: Welcome to the website! On the blog page, we will post updates on things we’ve done, so you can follow along with our progress. Please feel free to check out the other blog posts, and I hope you have a driving day!
